messages.message:
When I select the list data type, I get a table/array whyyyyyy?????

This should be a Markdown-style bulleted list.
@Jianqi Xing made the design for this
it shouldn't be too hard to change the format though, but we do need to decide what we want it to look like
I feel VERY strongly about this one. A list is not a table, ask any technical writer.

A list is not a table, 100 percent. Nor is a table a list.

If I tell you, as a person, that I’m giving you a list and I give you a table, you will be surprised.
User surprise is not usually a good experience.
@lydia This is my main feedback so far on data types. Other than it's great! Huge improvement! :grin:
CC: @Travis on visibility here since we display these very similarly in human review :eyes:
Melissa and I chatted about this yesterday

@melissa.amos the reason it's a table is because it's a list of fixed attributes. so rows (list) + columns (attributes) = table

How would you expect the bulleted list to look with the attributes?
screenshots would help :smile: are you seeing a table without adding any attributes?
Yes
I think I need to know how we define attributes?
I’m curious what those are too
theyre like object keys: imagine you have transactions, you can add attributes like date, type, account number
Makes sense for if there are no attributes, we should render that as a bulleted list (like we have currently in non-list fields)
cc @Serena to help Melissa with the copy
if there are attributes then what should be rendered? A two column table?
I don't think we should allow attributes for list. That's a table.
This is how it would work for attributes
@melissa.amos let's also touch on this in our sync later today. these designs were created a while ago and at the time we decided that list of attributes was a good way to represent list-of-objects.
these are things that will take some time and iteration with design to fix - so let's discuss this live

Hey! I wanted to recap action items from the call so we're on the same page:
• I believe we aligned on the general UI split / design is fine, but may need to iterate on copy (e.g. maybe "List" isn't the best word, but we should call it "one or more items"?)
• For now, we'll hold on making any changes, until we get more feedback from GTM team
• Look at what terminology competitors in the consumer document understanding landscape are using to refer to these things - there may be standardized language we can reuse (e.g. DocSumo)
    ◦ Is there someone who can take this up as an action item?
